intro: Oxytropis pulvinoides, commonly known as the yellow milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of western North America. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects. Oxytropis pulvinoides is also valued for its ornamental appeal in dry gardens.
